channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2348] 10 reasons to avoid talking on the phone - The Oatmeal
item.description: I avoid the phone at all costs. Here's why.

item.title: [+2229] xkcd: Devotion to Duty
[+2093] Check this out! [NSFW]
[+1945] Damn...You...Beer...Goggles!
item.description: Some drunken douchebags have an encounter with a transexual and get more than they wanted. By the looks of the size of her/him I don't fancy those lads chances if things get violent. I bet she/he can do nasty things with her/his handbag.

item.title: [+1895] USA Beats Canada in Men's Hockey Showdown
item.description: The United States men's hockey team, an outside contender for a medal at the Vancouver Games, shocked Canada, 5-3, and will force the home country's team to play an extra game to qualify for the elimination rounds of the Olympic tournament. It was a demoralizing blow to Canada.

item.title: [+1725] Fox News runs damage control after Ron Paul wins CPAC poll
item.description: Remember the big conservative conference Fox News has been hyping over the past 10 days? The Conservative Political Action Conference's presidential straw poll, a key marker of the mood among conservative voters, apparently didn't mean anything to the network. Or, at least that's what they said after Ron Paul won it. -=W/ VIDEO=-

item.title: [+1491] 15 Things You Should Know About Breasts (infographic)
item.description: Apparently breast reduction isn't just for women.

item.title: [+1370] 6 Insane Coincidences You Won't Believe Actually Happened
item.description: Look, if you dig deep enough everything is an amazing coincidence. But even cynics like us have to admit these are downright freaky.

item.title: [+1101] USA Series 'Burn Notice' Gets in on David Caruso Spoof Meme
item.description: (VID) Burn Notice character Sam Axe does the classic David Caruso (CSI: Miami) meme -- glasses on, dramatic line -- on a 'Burn Notice' episode. Pretty funny, for Horatio (Caruso) and CSI Miami fans...

item.title: [+1093] Apple removes over 5000 apps from app store
item.description: 1. No images of women in bikinis ( I personally found this rule highly hypocritical as the SI swimsuit app is a top app on iTunes.) 2. No images of men in bikinis 3. No skin 4. No silhouettes 5. No sexual connotations or innuendo. 6. Nothing that can be sexually arousing 7. No apps will be approved that in any way

item.title: [+1039] Good Job Canada!! [GIF]
[+1025] Schwarzenegger Rips Romney, GOP For Stimulus Hypocrisy
item.description: Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger (R-Calif.) accused his Republican colleagues in Washington on Sunday of blatant hypocrisy on the stimulus package -- railing against the jobs bill in public while poising for stimulus-related projects and ceremonies in their home districts.

item.title: [+955] Man Sitting on a Pool of Mercury [PIC]
item.description: A 1972 photo from the National Geographic magazine showing a man sitting on a pool of mercury.

item.title: [+935] NBC's Broken Olympic Coverage Annoys Absolutely Everyone
item.description: The mere structure of the NBC coverage has left a great deal to be desired this time around, and it came to a head last night when they shuffled the much-anticipated USA-Canada hockey game off to MSNBC, in part to use NBC as a showcase for probably the least anticipated of the figure skating events: ice dancing.

item.title: [+820] Google Celebrates Bacon...Or...Nevermind [PIC]
[+796] An MLB Pitcher's Recollection of Throwing a No-Hitter on LSD
item.description: Dock Ellis pitched for a half dozen teams including winning 19 games for the World Champion Pittsburgh Pirates in 1971. Ellis also started for the National League in the All Star game that season, but will always be remembered for one thing.

item.title: [+745] Fatally Flawed: Ubisoft's New DRM Scheme, Worst Misstep Yet
item.description: As heavy-handed, ridiculously strict, and unacceptably penalizing as it is, Ubisoft's new DRM scheme is only a symptom of a greater disease. Ubisoft's executives haven't just forgotten anything they ever knew about gaming, they've violated one of the primary rules of customer service; don't treat your legitimate customer base like the enemy.

item.title: [+693] Religious Assault on Democracy
item.description: This is a report of an intentional attempt to subvert the authority of our elected representatives with the goal of limiting and removing rights and protections guaranteed to the American citizenry. This is a report concerning the deliberate attack on democratic institutions as well as the Constitution.

item.title: [+682] Epic lie: I promise, I checked the fence last week!
